text: There was so much moon that night, that the city had become a village, and it was painful to read the long, crowded houses as proofs of printing without text. The moon was inventing barking, and dog statisticians went crazy trying to figure out where as many dogs as they could hear could be. They were creatures of invention, the true hungry dogs of the moon, the ones who bite that big bone of a dead world that is the moon. FIN
title: Las jaurías de la luna
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
